correspAction.name: the Secretary, Linnean Society of London

head.supplied: 26/7/80 ¶ ¶ I have been asked, honored Sir, to forward to the Linnéan Society the byefollowing 4th ¶ ¶ plate of Lepidoptera, which completes the illustration of an essay on the Adelaide Butterflies...

div.p: To the Secretary, Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Archives, Guard books, 1880-5, f. 16.

Correspondent inferred from location and content. The salutation that M uses is very unlike the forms he used in earlier letters to the Society's long-serving secretary, Richard Kippist, suggesting that he may have been aware that Kippist's post was being abolished (see Gage & Stearn (1988), p. 77) and that he needed to address the letter to somebody else. 26/7/80

I have been asked, honored Sir, to forward to the Linnéan Society the byefollowing 4th plate of Lepidoptera, which completes the illustration of an essay on the Adelaide Butterflies, sent to the Society by Mr O. Tepper.
In Tepper's letter to the Secretary of 19 June 1879 (Linnean Society, London, Archives, Guard books, 1880-85, f 11), with payment of part of his fees due on election as Fellow, he included ‘watercolour paintings of all South Australian Papilionidae mentioned in my paper on “Insects of S. Australia” with some short notes respecting their distribution in this region’. He added a marginal postscript: ‘uncontrollable circumstances have prevented me from completing figures 29–32. But they will be forwarded, if possible, next month.’

Ferd. von Mueller
MS annotation: R 22/22 Sept.
